ca.mcgill.ecse211.model

Class CanLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.CanLocator

  • public class CanLocator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows the EV3 to search for cans and identify their colors and weights. NOTE: Please refer to Software Document - Section 3.3 for detailed explanations of methods.
    Author:
    Mohamed Samee, Ketan Rampurkar, Carlo D'Angelo

    • Constructor Detail

      • CanLocator

        public CanLocator(Robot robot,
                  AssessCanColor assessCanColor,
                  AssessCanWeight assessCanWeight,
                  Clamp clamp,
                  SampleProvider usDistance,
                  float[] usData,
                  Navigation navigator,
                  LightLocalizer lightLocalizer)
           throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the default constructor of this class.
        Parameters:
        robot - instance of the Robot class
        assessCanColor - instance of the AssessCanColor class
        assessCanWeight - instance of the AssessCanWeight class
        clamp - instance of the Clamp class
        usDistance - sample provider from which to fetch ultrasonic sensor data
        usData - array in which to store the ultrasonic sensor data
        navigator - instance of the Navigator class
        lightLocalizer - instance of the LightLocalizer class
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

    • Method Detail

      • runLocator

        public void runLocator()
        This method runs the algorithm for the can searching. It drives the EV3 forward and in a square around the search zone and looks for cans. If a can is detected, it calls for the searchProcess(), otherwise it calls goToNext(). Once it has traveled around the whole zone without finding the correct can it then travels back to its starting corner.

      • searchProcess

        private void searchProcess()
        searchProcess() runs when the EV3 detects a can. It calls assessCan() to identify color and weight. Once done, calls travelToStartCorner() while having the can.

      • checkCan

        private boolean checkCan(double angle)
        checkCan() returns true if a can was spotted by the ultrasonic sensor within the range of a tile. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        angle - amount (in degrees) that the robot has to scan
        Returns:
        boolean value representing whether a can was spotted (true) or not (false)

      • assessCan

        private void assessCan(double distance)
        assessCan() is a method that is called after checkCan(). It makes the EV3 beep depending on the color as well as the weight of the can scanned.
        Parameters:
        distance - distance(cm) that the robot has to travel to the can

      • goToNext

        private void goToNext()
        goToNext() uses travelTo() to drive the EV3 forward to the next position when no cans are detected.

      • travelToStartCorner

        private void travelToStartCorner()
        travelToStartCorner() is called when a can is found and its weight and color have been identified. This method will use travelTo() from the Navigator class to get the EV3 back to the initial start corner.

      • readUSDistance

        private int readUSDistance()
        Method that fetches data from the ultrasonic sensor.
        Returns:
        distance (cm) from the wall
